elements.title: 701,133 flags
elements.contents: ... that 701,133 flags were planted on the National Mall (pictured) as a memorial to Americans who have died of COVID-19?

elements.title: coat of arms of the Football Association
elements.contents: ... that the lions supporting the coat of arms of the Football Association are half-blue and half-white in imitation of the blue shorts and white shirts worn by the national teams?

elements.title: Castle Recording Laboratory
elements.contents: ... that Castle Recording Laboratory, Nashville's first commercial recording studio, was established in a repurposed hotel banquet room?

elements.title: Max Wallraf
elements.contents: ... that Max Wallraf replaced Paul Löbe as President of the Reichstag for a few months in 1924–25?

elements.title: The Gaslight Effect
elements.contents: ... that Robin Stern's book The Gaslight Effect describes gaslighting as an epidemic?

elements.title: Gambara
elements.contents: ... that according to legend, the god of wisdom Odin was tricked by his own wife, and her priestess Gambara, to give victory to Gambara's tribe?

elements.title: Statutes Fair
elements.contents: ... that the Statutes Fair in Burton upon Trent has been held annually since 1219?

elements.title: Ralph Page
elements.contents: ... that Ralph Page once called a contra dance for more than 4000 people in Tokyo, despite not knowing Japanese?
